meanings.definition: In a manner relating to or characteristic of a colony.
meanings.sent1: The explorers traveled colonially across the vast ocean to reach the new land.
meanings.sent2: The villagers dressed colonially for the annual celebration of their settlement's founding.
meanings.sent3: The children played colonially, pretending to establish their own tiny colony in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The old map was drawn colonially, showing the borders of the distant territories.
meanings.sent5: The flags fluttered colonially in the breeze, marking the boundaries of the conquered land.

meanings.definition: In a manner resembling or typical of colonial times.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed artifacts from the past colonially, showcasing the tools and clothing of early settlers.
meanings.sent2: The architecture of the building was designed colonially, with grand columns and intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The play was performed colonially, with actors dressed in period costumes and speaking in old-fashioned language.
meanings.sent4: The novel was written colonially, transporting readers back to a time of exploration and discovery.
